reviewText: I generally like Rick Steves, but he covers only the major tourist destinations.  There are many interesting places that he does not show or seem to know about: in Belfast, there is most bombed hotel in the world; there is an Ulster America Folk Park in County Tyrone that is fascinating.  In Scotland, he could have shown remnants of Roman Roads, Norman churches, and St. Andrews.
Title: Rick Steves' Ireland and Scotland, 2000-2007

reviewText: Has there ever been another travel guide more amiable, more informative, more eclectic and just plain likeable than Rick Steves?  This somewhat nerdish but pleasant looking fellow will immediately win the viewer over with his charm, humor and smoothing, layback manner. However what will keep you watching program after program is his consummate knowledge of the sites and people he visits.While each journey is only 30 minutes in length Rick has a unique talent of synthesizing the many facets that make up a people and place. He leaves no stone unturned in his analysis; historical background, spiritual heritage, cultural underpinnings and political legacy are all equally touched upon to give the audience a fuller understanding of the rural and urban landscape.However not not an individual to dwell too much on the past, he provides a delightful tour of the markets, music, restaurants and nightlife. The kind of information would really want to know if you're out for a good time.The production values are also wonderful offering fanstastic visuals that are worth watching even if there where no commentary. Traveling with Rick Steves' is the next best thing to being there.This particular DVD contains six episodes, thirty minutes in length. Imagine three hours in Ireland and Scotland await, better get started!
summary: "Keep On Traveling" ~ On The Road With Rick Steves'
Title: Rick Steves' Ireland and Scotland, 2000-2007

reviewText: I love seeing what to expect when I get there!  For that this DVD is perfect.
summary: Almost like visiting Ireland and Scotland
Title: Rick Steves' Ireland and Scotland, 2000-2007

reviewText: I have thoroughly enjoyed this series.  I used Rick's books for 2 trips to Italy and was able to plan everything without the use of a tour guide. (Rick's material was the guide)  I am now using these videos to research a trip to Ireland and have already benefited.  Anyone wanting to travel overseas should definitely check out the available resources from Rick Steves.
Title: Rick Steves' Ireland and Scotland, 2000-2007

reviewText: Rick Steves travel DVDs are such a pleasure to watch and enjoy. This DVD of Ireland and Scotland is especially wonderful and the scenery is magnificent.
Title: Rick Steves' Ireland and Scotland, 2000-2007

reviewText: Rick Steves is so good at this that I enjoy all of his series. I am not able to travel any longer but Rick helps me to remember where I have been and the changes since I have been at certain lands.
Title: Rick Steves' Ireland and Scotland, 2000-2007

reviewText: I have been to Ireland and all over Scotland on many trips.  This DVD provides a pretty fair representation of both.  I would indeed recommend it to friend and family.
Title: Rick Steves' Ireland and Scotland, 2000-2007

reviewText: This CD lives up the to usual quality, and content you expect from Rick Steves.  BUT - it did not play in my dvd player.  Luckily it did play on my computer or I would have been very unhappy.  They need to monitor the QC a bit more and be sure of the maximum compatibility or give a big warning in the purchase process regarding the DVD format they are and are NOT compatible with.
summary: Content good, of course - but dvd compatibility was a problem.
Title: Rick Steves' Ireland and Scotland, 2000-2007
